data.title: added a blue tiberium blossom tree.
map editor feature: see brush preview when copy/pasting
data.body: When you are placing a tile, you get a preview in your mouse cursor when you hover over tiles in the map editor. When you copy/paste however you do not get this preview, only an outline of the space your copied tiles would take up. Would be very helpful to have the preview and be able to see what you are doing.

Needs testing
This button will automagically assign players to teams and try to have the teams even too

data.title: Save Game Support
data.body:
It could just dump the current state of all units into a `map.yaml` file for the following use-cases:
- Share auto-save files to better reproduce and understand desyncs.
- Restart the game loading an auto-save when a player dropped.
- Finish the longer single-player missions tomorrow.

data.title: encourage oil rig capturing
data.body: when an engi captures an oilrig, you get credits for that. like in generals. 1000 instant credit and then y$ each x seconds. would encourage oil rig capturing.

data.title: Classic mods
data.body: This includes cnc-classic and ra-classic. I added some more switches to allow the recreation of legacy game rules. Current task list is available at #2740. It is already stable. The GUI reskins are not finished so this should not be shipped yet.

data.title: maps not showing up in map browser
data.body: Lets force all maps in default folder to show up on map browser, else move them

data.title: Allow easy creation & management of factions
data.body:
What do you guys think of the idea of enabling factions in RA and CNC? The idea really appeals to me. I think it should be an option in the game lobby. 

I would really like to see something like this implemented. It would be nice if game code allowed you to make factions really easily, and specify them in a map's game rules. Like: 

```
PlayerFaction: allies2
    FactionName: England
    UnitsDisable:
        Units: JEEP, HELI, ARTY, APC
    AllowUnits: 
        Units: 5TNK, APCW, E8, A10
```

<bountysource-plugin>

---

Want to back this issue? **[Place a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/116641-allow-easy-creation-management-of-factions?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Use engineers to defuse mines
data.body: Currently there is nothing to counter mines directly other than switching to air units only or iron curtained units against vehicle mines or nuking might help, never tried. I suggest to let the engineers do this job. Not sure if they should remove or capture them. That would give them an additional purpose.

data.title: Renderer refactoring - Duplication
data.body:
More cleanups spun off my voxels branch.
These remove some of the unnecessary plumbing required when adding new renderer features.

data.title: Bursts reload when idle
data.body:
If a unit has burst but they have not fully spent all their bursts by firing, the next time they fire they will only have the remaining bursts left to fire with. This can be disadvantage if your have a lot of bursts, but only have one shot left. After firing, you then have to wait a long time for the unit to reload again.

Proposal: Say you have finished firing but still have unfired bursts remaining. You wait for your ROF time to pass, and then your unit begins to reload, one shot at a time. Example: Say you have Burst:4  and ROF:100. You fire 3 shots, and have one left. Your unit then pauses for 100 ticks. At that point, one burst is reloaded every X ticks, where X is the BurstDelay value (default=5). So the total reload time would be 100 + 5 + 5 + 5 = 115.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/115665-bursts-reload-when-idle?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Show proper error message when connecting to a server of different version
data.body:
Currently, if a client joins a server that has a different version, the client will be immediately disconnected with error "Connection Failed" without telling any reason why it failed. This can be confusing and mislead people into thinking there is a problem with their connection to the server.

Instead, it should be told that the server is running a different version than the client.

On the server list this problem does not show up (connecting to different versions is not allowed) - it will appear when attempting to connect to the server via direct connect.

data.title: defaults.yaml: unit speeds fix; husk burn; tanks explode small
data.body:
Vehicle speeds adjusted, now 80% on clear, like tanks. Intended to coincide with speed changes here: https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/2722
Husks burn 10 seconds now instead of 40. More fitting for cnc.
Tanks UnitExplodeSmall now by default.

data.title: system.yaml: blue tiberium fix; crate fix (no mcvs)
data.body:
Blue tiberium now poisons infantry
Crates no longer provide MCVs
levelup crate removed
crate lifetime increased

data.title: misc. updates
data.body:
a-10 no longer targetable
missiles can't hit it anyway, so it's a distraction.

data.title: vehicles.yaml update; a few smaller updates.
data.body: see https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/2671 for details and rationales

data.title: weapons.yaml update for CNC
data.body: See https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/2655 for details and rationales.

data.title: Diagonal scrolling area in viewport corners are too small
data.body: In comparison I'd say in RA95 and C&C95 they're twice as large. It feels odd scrolling diagonally.

data.title: Additional Hotkeys
data.body: I had a look at http://ra.afraid.org/html/ra/hotkeys.html to find more keyboard shortcuts that might be useful for OpenRA. Also the _hotkey-addon_ by @TiriliPiitPiit is not yet completely integrated because it was hard-coded to Red Alert units. Ideas and patches are welcome.

data.title: remove admin indicator icon to avoid confusion/overlapping
data.body:
It is annoying because
- it uses the Dune 2000 bad ping / connection interrupted icon
- it collides with the other widgets
- red on red is hard to see

Print admin names in bold text instead. This is also forgery-proof.
